intro: Elephantorrhiza burkei, commonly known as the African sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in sandy or coastal environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers and has compound leaves with sharp, spine-like tips. It is adapted to arid conditions and plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils. Its unique morphology and ecological significance make it an important species in its native habitat.
